name: Minsk
fun_fact: Fun fact: Minsk was 80% destroyed in WWII but rebuilt in grandiose Stalinist architecture - Independence Avenue is one of the longest and widest Soviet-era boulevards in the world at 15km, lined with imposing buildings that feel like stepping back in time!

hero_dishes.name: Draniki
hero_dishes.description: Crispy potato pancakes, Belarus's national dish - often served with sour cream
hero_dishes.origin_story: The humble potato is central to Belarusian cuisine - draniki are made from grated raw potatoes fried until golden

hero_dishes.name: Machanka
hero_dishes.description: Thick meat gravy with sausages and pork ribs, served with draniki or bliny
hero_dishes.origin_story: A hearty peasant dish for cold winters - the gravy is rich and meaty

hero_dishes.name: Kholodnik
hero_dishes.description: Cold beet soup served in summer - bright pink and refreshing
hero_dishes.origin_story: Similar to Lithuanian ≈°altibar≈°ƒçiai, this chilled soup is perfect for summer
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Available in summer at most traditional restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Kolduny
hero_dishes.description: Meat-filled dumplings, the Belarusian version of Polish pierogi
hero_dishes.origin_story: Hearty potato dumplings filled with meat, showing Lithuanian-Polish influences

signature_drinks.name: Kvas
signature_drinks.description: Fermented bread drink, slightly sweet and tangy
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: From street tanks in summer - refreshing and traditional

signature_drinks.name: Krambambula
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: As digestif or warming winter drink
